net.objectzoo.events.impl

Class EventAsyncAdapter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.events.impl.EventAsyncAdapter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the information parameter the event provides
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Consumer<T>, Action<T>, ActionAsync<T>, Event<T>, EventAsyncDelegate<T>, EventDelegate<T>

    public class EventAsyncAdapter<T>
extends Object
implements EventAsyncDelegate<T>
    The EventAsyncAdapter is class that adapts an EventDelegate to EventAsyncDelegate so that the original delegates subscribers can be invoked asynchronously. All asynchronous event distributions are executed in another thread. The Executor to use for the asynchronous event distributions can be chosen during creation of this helper. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.
    Author:
    tilmann

    • Method Detail

      • beginAccept

        public ActionAsyncResult beginAccept(Consumer<ActionAsyncResult> callback,
                                     Object asyncState,
                                     T parameter)
        This beginInvoke implementation invokes all event subscribers in another thread in the order they have been subscribed.
        Specified by:
        beginAccept in interface ActionAsync<T>
        Parameters:
        callback - the ActionAsyncCallback, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of invocation of all event subscribers and receives the same ActionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations ActionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        parameter - the parameter to invoke the subscribers with
        Returns:
        the ActionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
